name: Mamere
desc: A Melusine artist who lives in Merusea Village.

value.name: Mamere
value.desc:
Mamere

A Melusine that paints every day.

"Because painting the things that I want to brings me happiness!"

customize.text:
Melusine Mamere, like other Melusines, was born from wounds received by their "Father" Elynas during the battle between the Marechaussee Hunters and members of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo more than 400 years ago. Each Melusine was born with a shard of broken Meks, so they began to consider these objects as their "tokens," which must be protected. Mamere's "token" was the artificed clockwork relay module of the mechanical dog Seymour, which was created by Alain Guillotin to protect his sister Mary-Ann Guillotin during Marechaussee Phantom duties. Mamere found Seymour among the wreckage, repaired him, and brought him to her home. Since Mamere possessed a part of this Mek, she could talk to him, although she did not know that the Mek itself was in hibernation mode, playing only pre-recorded phrases.
While all the other Melusines lost the ability to speak with their progenitor and forgot about him, Mamere remained the only one who heard Elynas. In addition, she had a unique vision of art that even her sisters could not understand. For her paintings, Mamere used a special red ore, which, unbeknownst to Mamere, was the crystallized blood of Elynas.

For some reason, even though it's just an ore, it almost feels warm... Is your hand too cold?

customize.text:
One day, the mysterious art collector Jakob Ingold became interested in Mamere's special colors and tried to buy her paintings. He sent a group of Eremites to Mamere, and the Traveler saw their meeting. The Traveler drove the mercenaries away, and out of gratitude, Mamere offered to draw a picture. They went to Mamere's home in Merusea Village and met her mechanical dog, Seymour.
To draw the picture, Mamere needed a special ore for colors, which could only be mined near Melusines' village. While the Traveler and Paimon were helping Mamere with the ore, the Eremites and Jakob, who had previously tried to buy Mamere's painting, came to her house. Since Mamere refused to give the ore to Jakob, he ordered it to be taken away by force, and during the battle with the Traveler, the mercenaries broke Seymour. Mamere asked the Traveler to help her fix Seymour and sent them to collect special parts. After Seymour was repaired, earthquakes began in the village, and the Melusines' progenitor asked Mamere to save his children.
It turned out that Jakob was a member of the secret and radical organization, the Narzissenkreuz Ordo, and the first Neohuman. He was trying to revive the petrified heart of Elynas, since he used Elynas's blood to enhance his powers. After the battle with Jakob, Elynas asked Mamere to draw a picture with which he communicated with the Traveler.

Elynas told the story about how he was saved from the abyss and loneliness by his Mother and, together with his siblings, went to see the world. However, it turned out that everything Elynas touched was poisoned. In order not to destroy Fontaine, he decided to die. At the end of the conversation, Elynas asked the Traveler to convey Mamere a message.

<color=#ffffffd9>"Your paintings are very beautiful. I love you, and I'm so very proud of you."</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"Please get along with your sisters â€” they love you very much as well."</color>
After the battle with Jakob, Seymour remembered the name of his former Master, Mary-Ann, and embarked on a journey to find her, promising Mamere to return with the Traveler.

customize.name: Strange Part
customize.desc:
A strange mechanical part obtained near Merusea Village. It looks subtly different from common mechanical parts.

You have no idea why it ended up here, but beautiful metal products like this are loved by Melusines...

customize.text: When Seymour completed his mission and found his Master Mary-Ann, she told him to live the way Seymour himself wanted, and he chose to return to Mamere. He invited her to go on a journey with him, Oceanid Ann and Mary-Ann, and she happily agreed. During the time that Seymour was away, Mamere began to explore other styles of painting, and even other Melusines, who had previously not understood Mamere's paintings, began to admire them. Before her journey, Mamere left Traveler a painting in a new style, where she painted herself, Seymour, Traveler, and Paimon.
